did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The Carl Haldor Johnson Collection contains an album of photographs of Carl Haldor Johnson, a Georgetown resident, along with snapshots of his family and friends.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Carl Haldor Johnson (b. ca. 1903) grew up in Georgetown on the Weston Road, where he lived with his Finnish immigrant parents, Olga Exenia and Carl A. Johnson. Several other close relatives lived in town: Gustav and Esther Johnson, Mathias Maurits Mattson (father of Rolan S. Mattson), and Frank Eliel and Anna R. Johnson. Gustav Johnson - either Carl Haldor's cousin or his uncle - was married to Mathias Maurits Mattson's sister. The family was employed by the Gilbert & Bennett Mfg. Co. Carl Haldor's father was a wire drawer and so was Maurits Mattson; Frank Eliel was a galvanizer; Carl Haldor started off a spool winder, but later found other employment first in the construction business and then in a hat factory.
Carl Haldor married Muriel Margaret Howard (b. 1909), a trained nurse, in 1937.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Carl Haldor Johnson Collection is comprised of a single photograph album containing snapshots of Carl Haldor Johnson, his family, and friends. Local sites featured in the album include Georgetown from Gilbert Farm; Danbury Road in Georgetown; Lagner's Farm, Cannondale; Old Stone Bridge, South Wilton; Bellow's Place, Silvermine; Bantam Lake; Lover's Lea; New Milford; New London; Cedarcliff, Ward Street, Norwalk; Greenwich Boat Club.
